questions.question: Evaluate the definite integral \(\int_0^1 x^2(x^3+2)^4\,dx\).
Evaluate \(\int_0^{\pi/4}\tan x\,dx\).
Evaluate \(\int_1^{e^2}\dfrac{4}{x}\,dx\).
A particle moves along the x‑axis with velocity \(v(t)=t^3-3t^2-t+3\) m/s. On the interval \([0,4]\), how many times does the particle change direction?
questions.explanation: Factor: \(v(t)=(t-1)(t+1)(t-3)\). Zeros in \([0,4]\): \(t=1\) and \(t=3\) (note \(t=-1\) is outside the interval). Check signs: \(v(0)=3>0\), \(v(2)=(1)(3)(-1)=-3<0\), \(v(4)=(3)(5)(1)=15>0\). The velocity changes sign at \(t=1\) and \(t=3\), so the particle changes direction 2 times.

questions.question: Find the average value of \(f(x)=e^x\) on the interval \([0,2]\).
Let \(f(x)=x^4+x-3\). Which of the following correctly applies the Intermediate Value Theorem to guarantee a zero on the given interval?
questions.explanation: IVT requires a sign change. \(f(1)=1+1-3=-1<0\) and \(f(2)=16+2-3=15>0\). Since \(f\) is continuous and changes sign on \([1,2]\), there is a zero there. The other intervals have the same sign at both endpoints.

questions.question: Find the general solution to the differential equation \(\dfrac{dy}{dx}=x\sqrt{y}\).
Let \(R(x)=\int_0^x(t^2+\sin t)\,dt\). Find \(R'(x)\).
questions.explanation: By the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus Part 1, differentiating an integral with a variable upper limit gives the integrand evaluated at that limit: \(R'(x)=x^2+\sin x\).

questions.question: Differentiate \(f(x)=\ln(x^2+4)\).
Find \(f'(x)\) if \(f(x)=\sin^3 x\).
questions.explanation: Write \(f(x)=(\sin x)^3\). Chain rule: \(f'(x)=3(\sin x)^2\cdot\cos x=3\sin^2 x\cos x\).

questions.question: Let \(f(x)=\begin{cases}\dfrac{x^3-8}{x-2} & x\ne2\\k & x=2\end{cases}\). What value of \(k\) makes \(f\) continuous at \(x=2\)?
questions.explanation: Factor the numerator: \(x^3-8=(x-2)(x^2+2x+4)\). For \(x\ne2\): \(\frac{x^3-8}{x-2}=x^2+2x+4\). As \(x\to2\): \(4+4+4=12\). For continuity, \(k=12\).

questions.question: Find all x‑values where \(f(x)=2x^4-4x^2+1\) has a point of inflection.
questions.explanation: \(f'(x)=8x^3-8x\), \(f''(x)=24x^2-8=8(3x^2-1)\). Set \(f''=0\): \(x^2=\frac{1}{3}\) ⇒ \(x=\pm\frac{1}{\sqrt{3}}=\pm\frac{\sqrt{3}}{3}\). Since \(f''\) changes sign at both values, these are both inflection points.

questions.question: Use implicit differentiation to find \(\dfrac{dy}{dx}\) for \(y^3+x^2y=10\).
Find the equation of the normal line to \(y=\sqrt{x}\) at the point \((4,2)\).
questions.explanation: \(y'=\frac{1}{2\sqrt{x}}\). At \(x=4\): tangent slope \(=\frac{1}{4}\). Normal slope \(=-4\). Equation: \(y-2=-4(x-4)\) ⟹ \(y=-4x+18\).

questions.question: Let \(f(x)=x^3 e^x\). Find the instantaneous rate of change of \(f\) at \(x=1\).
If \(h(0)=-4\) and \(h(6)=8\), find \(\int_0^6 h'(x)\,dx\).
questions.explanation: By the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus: \(\int_0^6 h'(x)\,dx=h(6)-h(0)=8-(-4)=12\).

questions.question: For \(f(x)=\dfrac{1}{x}\) on \([1,4]\), find the value of \(c\) in \((1,4)\) guaranteed by the Mean Value Theorem.
Differentiate \(f(x)=\dfrac{\sin x}{1+\cos x}\).
questions.explanation: Quotient rule: \(f'(x)=\frac{\cos x(1+\cos x)-\sin x(-\sin x)}{(1+\cos x)^2}=\frac{\cos x+\cos^2 x+\sin^2 x}{(1+\cos x)^2}=\frac{\cos x+1}{(1+\cos x)^2}=\frac{1}{1+\cos x}\).

questions.question: A particle has velocity \(v(t)=-t^2+8t-12\) ft/s on \([0,6]\). Find the minimum value of the velocity on this interval.
Determine the intervals on which \(f(x)=\ln x - x\) (for \(x>0\)) is increasing.
Which of the following functions is NOT differentiable at \(x=0\)?
questions.explanation: \(f(x)=x^{2/3}\) has a cusp at \(x=0\): \(f'(x)=\frac{2}{3}x^{-1/3}\to\infty\) as \(x\to0\), so it is not differentiable there. The other functions (\(x^{4/3}\), \(x^2\), \(|x|^3\)) are all differentiable at \(x=0\) with derivative 0.

questions.question: Oil leaks from a tank at a rate of \(r(t)=3t^2+2t\) gallons per hour. How many gallons leak from \(t=1\) to \(t=3\) hours?

The derivative \(f'(x)\) is undefined at \(x=0\) but positive on both sides; changes from positive to negative at \(x=3\); and changes from negative to positive at \(x=7\). Classify each critical point.
options: Neither at \(x=0\), max at \(x=3\), min at \(x=7\)
Max at \(x=0\), max at \(x=3\), min at \(x=7\)
Neither at \(x=0\), min at \(x=3\), max at \(x=7\)
Min at \(x=0\), max at \(x=3\), min at \(x=7\)
questions.explanation: First Derivative Test: positive on both sides of \(x=0\) ⇒ no sign change ⇒ neither. Positive to negative at \(x=3\) ⇒ relative maximum. Negative to positive at \(x=7\) ⇒ relative minimum.

questions.question: Find the area under the curve \(y=x^2+2x\) from \(x=0\) to \(x=3\).
At \(x=a\), a function satisfies \(f(a)>0\), \(f'(a)=0\), and \(f''(a)<0\). What can be concluded about \(f\) at \(x=a\)?
options: \(f\) has a local maximum; the graph is above the x‑axis and concave down
\(f\) has a local minimum; the graph is above the x‑axis and concave up
\(f\) has an inflection point above the x‑axis
\(f\) has a local maximum; the graph is below the x‑axis and concave down
questions.explanation: \(f'(a)=0\) and \(f''(a)<0\) ⇒ local maximum by the Second Derivative Test. \(f(a)>0\) ⇒ above the x‑axis. \(f''(a)<0\) ⇒ concave down.

questions.question: Evaluate \(\int_0^2(x^3-4x)\,dx\).
Find the area of the region enclosed by \(y=4\) and \(y=x^2\).
For \(f(x)=\dfrac{x}{x^2+1}\), the second derivative is \(f''(x)=\dfrac{2x(x^2-3)}{(x^2+1)^3}\). On which interval is \(f\) concave up?
questions.explanation: \(f''(x)=\frac{2x(x^2-3)}{(x^2+1)^3}\). The denominator is always positive. \(f''>0\) when \(2x(x^2-3)>0\): (i) \(x>0\) and \(x^2>3\) ⇒ \(x>\sqrt{3}\); (ii) \(x<0\) and \(x^2<3\) ⇒ \(-\sqrt{3}<x<0\). So \(f\) is concave up on \((-\sqrt{3},0)\cup(\sqrt{3},\infty)\).

questions.question: Find the equation of the tangent line to \(f(x)=\arctan x\) at \(x=1\).
A person 6 ft tall walks away from a street lamp 15 ft high at 4 ft/s. At what rate is the length of their shadow increasing?
questions.explanation: Let \(x\) = distance from lamp, \(s\) = shadow length. By similar triangles: \(\frac{15}{x+s}=\frac{6}{s}\) ⇒ \(15s=6x+6s\) ⇒ \(9s=6x\) ⇒ \(s=\frac{2x}{3}\). Differentiate: \(\frac{ds}{dt}=\frac{2}{3}\frac{dx}{dt}=\frac{2}{3}(4)=\frac{8}{3}\) ft/s.

questions.question: A room cools according to Newton's Law of Cooling: \(T(t)=70+130e^{-kt}\). If \(T(0)=200^\circ\)F and \(T(10)=120^\circ\)F, find \(T(20)\).
Find all relative extrema of \(f(x)=\dfrac{x^2}{x^2+4}\) using the First Derivative Test.
The function \(f(x)=\begin{cases}ax+b & x\le2\\x^2+1 & x>2\end{cases}\) is both continuous and differentiable at \(x=2\). Find \(a\) and \(b\).
questions.explanation: Continuity: \(2a+b=2^2+1=5\). Differentiability: left derivative \(=a\); right derivative \(=2(2)=4\). So \(a=4\), then \(b=5-8=-3\). Verify: \(f(2^-)=4(2)-3=5\) and \(f(2^+)=4+1=5\) ✓

questions.question: Use the midpoint Riemann sum with \(n=3\) equal subintervals to approximate \(\int_0^6 f(x)\,dx\), given \(f(1)=3\), \(f(3)=7\), \(f(5)=5\).
Find the critical points of \(f(x)=x-2\sin x\) on \([0,2\pi]\).
The region bounded by \(y=\sqrt{x}\) and \(y=x\) (for \(0\le x\le1\)) is rotated about the x‑axis. Find the volume using the washer method.
questions.explanation: On \([0,1]\): \(\sqrt{x}\ge x\). Outer radius \(R=\sqrt{x}\), inner radius \(r=x\). Volume \(=\pi\int_0^1\bigl[(\sqrt{x})^2-x^2\bigr]\,dx=\pi\int_0^1(x-x^2)\,dx=\pi\left[\frac{x^2}{2}-\frac{x^3}{3}\right]_0^1=\pi\left(\frac{1}{2}-\frac{1}{3}\right)=\frac{\pi}{6}\).

questions.question: At what x‑values on \(y=x^3-x\) is the tangent line parallel to \(y=2x-1\)?
Consider \(f(x)=\begin{cases}x\sin\!\left(\dfrac{1}{x}\right) & x\ne0\\0 & x=0\end{cases}\). Is \(f\) differentiable at \(x=0\)?
questions.explanation: \(f'(0)=\lim_{h\to0}\frac{f(h)-f(0)}{h}=\lim_{h\to0}\frac{h\sin(1/h)}{h}=\lim_{h\to0}\sin\!\left(\frac{1}{h}\right)\). This limit does not exist because \(\sin(1/h)\) oscillates between \(-1\) and \(1\). So \(f\) is not differentiable at \(x=0\).

questions.question: Let \(W(x)=\int_x^{2x} t^2\,dt\). Find \(W'(x)\).
questions.explanation: By FTC with variable limits in both bounds: \(W'(x)=(2x)^2\cdot\frac{d}{dx}(2x)-x^2\cdot\frac{d}{dx}(x)=4x^2\cdot2-x^2\cdot1=8x^2-x^2=7x^2\).

questions.question: Evaluate \(\displaystyle\lim_{x\to0}\frac{\tan x - x}{x^3}\).
questions.explanation: Using the Taylor series \(\tan x=x+\frac{x^3}{3}+\cdots\): \(\frac{\tan x-x}{x^3}=\frac{x^3/3+\cdots}{x^3}\to\frac{1}{3}\) as \(x\to0\). Alternatively, apply L'Hôpital three times: \(\frac{\sec^2 x-1}{3x^2}=\frac{\tan^2 x}{3x^2}\to\frac{2\sec^2 x\tan x}{6x}\to\frac{2\sec^4 x+4\sec^2 x\tan^2 x}{6}\to\frac{2}{6}=\frac{1}{3}\).

questions.question: A rectangle is inscribed in a right triangle with legs 6 and 8, with one side of the rectangle along the leg of length 8. Find the dimensions and maximum area of the rectangle.
questions.explanation: Let width \(x\) be along the leg of length 8, height \(y\) along the leg of length 6. By similar triangles: \(\frac{y}{6}=\frac{8-x}{8}\) ⇒ \(y=\frac{3(8-x)}{4}\). Area \(A=xy=\frac{3x(8-x)}{4}\). \(\frac{dA}{dx}=\frac{3(8-2x)}{4}=0\) ⇒ \(x=4\), \(y=3\). Max area \(=4\times3=12\).

questions.question: Use the Second Derivative Test to classify all critical points of \(f(x)=3x^4-4x^3-12x^2+5\).
options: Local max at \(x=0\) (\(f=5\)); local minima at \(x=-1\) (\(f=0\)) and \(x=2\) (\(f=-27\))
Local min at \(x=0\); local maxima at \(x=\pm1\)

questions.question: Use the midpoint Riemann sum with \(n=4\) equal subintervals to approximate \(\int_0^4\sqrt{x}\,dx\).
Find \(\dfrac{d}{dx}\left[x\arcsin x\right]\).
A particle has position \(s(t)=t^3-6t^2+9t+1\). Find the acceleration at each moment when the velocity is zero.
Find the absolute maximum and minimum values of \(f(x)=x+\dfrac{4}{x}\) on \([1,6]\).
options: Absolute max \(\dfrac{20}{3}\) at \(x=6\); absolute min \(4\) at \(x=2\)
Absolute max 5 at \(x=1\); absolute min 4 at \(x=2\)
Absolute max \(\dfrac{20}{3}\) at \(x=6\); absolute min 5 at \(x=1\)
Absolute max \(\dfrac{20}{3}\) at \(x=6\); absolute min 0 at \(x=4\)

questions.question: Solve the initial value problem \(\dfrac{dy}{dx}=\dfrac{x}{y^2}\), \(y(0)=2\).
A particle moves with velocity \(v(t)=e^t-2\) on \([0,\ln 4]\). Find the total distance traveled.
Differentiate \(f(x)=(\ln x)^4\).
questions.explanation: Write \(f(x)=(\ln x)^4\). Chain rule: \(f'(x)=4(\ln x)^3\cdot\frac{d}{dx}(\ln x)=4(\ln x)^3\cdot\frac{1}{x}=\frac{4(\ln x)^3}{x}\).

questions.question: Use linear approximation at \(x=0\) to estimate \(\sin(0.1)\).
